thread.title: Midlands residents react to damage cause by heavy storms
thread.title_full: Midlands residents react to damage cause by heavy storms

author: @wis10
title: Midlands residents react to damage cause by heavy storms
text:
Midlands residents react to damage cause by heavy storms
FAIRFIELD COUNTY, S.C. (WIS) - Residents across the Midlands are reacting to the damage done following Wednesday morning storms.
Fairfield County has seen some damage from severe weather.
WIS News 10 spoke with a gas station in Ridgeway, one who said a new roof flew off the building into the ground.
Victor Sherman said the new roof was about three to four years old.
“This happened around 8’o’clock. I was inside the store, I just heard one ‘boom!’” Sherman said.
Sherman said he was inside his business when the roof blew off.
“As soon as I go on that side, I see the whole roof was down,” Sherman.
After losing his roof, heavy rain got in and damaged the business' ceiling tiles and insulation.
Sherman said he is facing the possibility of closing up shop for a few days if he wants it to get fixed before the next time it rains.
“It’s really going to hurt. Lease is going to be the same, bills are going to be the same. We’re going to have to shut down for a couple of days. It’s Mother Nature. You can’t fight with that,” Sherman said.
Throughout the county residents were woken up by the sound of strong winds and heavy rain.
“I mean I didn’t clock it but still it was ferocious,” said Gena McCoy
The winds in the county were gusting to about 40 miles per hour.
According to the National Weather Service, this was likely caused by straight line winds. And says they’ve had no other reports of damage in the county.
